It has been widely reported that Trump """"rented"""" the space in Trump tower to his campaign. Then the campaign paid the rent to him. Looks like a fleecing to me. If he were really self funding, he would have donated the space. He is out to make as much money as he can. I can't wait until all you Trumpster's figure out youv'e been bamboozled. It's troubling how many people are willing to abandon many principles that make democracies and free economies work in favour of perceived, short-term goals. Globalization is here to stay. There's nothing Donald Trump can do about it. Slapping higher tariffs on consumer goods only hurts consumers - working people. The resulting downturn in demand would then harm small businesses and new enterprises (they too could see higher supply costs as well). Free trade and globalization (ie, free market economics) aren't the problem. It's the advance of technology that ultimately threatens jobs. What Trump has delivered to Carrier workers is a temporary reprieve from their inevitable obsolescence. Inside 15 years, if not sooner, AI, autonomous machines, and robots will be replacing most Carrier employees. Retraining programmes would go so much farther than the state strong-arming business. The gig economy can help provide many jobs, especially if there's market liberalization allowing disruptive businesses to get a foothold in the economy. The government in the boardrooms and offices of business isn't the path to economic growth or personal liberty.
